body_html: We have this, we call them JIT C++ extensions: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_cpp_extensions.py#L200. Basically you pass your source as a string to torch.utils.cpp_extension.load_inline() and it compiles it for you in the background. They've been around for a few months, but they appeared after the official tutorial, so you might have missed them. Or I need to update the tutorial

body: We have this, we call them JIT C++ extensions: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_cpp_extensions.py#L200. Basically you pass your source as a string to ` torch.utils.cpp_extension.load_inline()` and it compiles it for you in the background. They've been around for a few months, but they appeared after the official tutorial, so you might have missed them. Or I need to update the tutorial
